# Darwhin Gomez

New York, New York  
Darwhin88@gmail.com  
347-491-2955  
[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/darwhin) | [GitHub](https://github.com/dw8888)  

---

## Summary
Solutions-focused technologist with experience designing AWS architectures, automated data pipelines, and agentic AI tooling that shortens feedback loops and accelerates application throughput.

## Core Competencies
- Python (pandas, scikit-learn, seaborn, PyTorch)  
- SQL / NoSQL  
- AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, DynamoDB, Glue, QuickSight, Bedrock, Macie, SageMaker)  
- Azure (App Service, Functions, Storage)  
- ETL/ELT (Glue, SSIS) & Data Modeling  
- Generative AI (LLMs, prompt structuring, fine-tuning, guardrails)  
- Data Visualization (QuickSight, Power BI)  
- Security (SIEM, IDS, Active Directory, Linux)  
- Automation & CI/CD  
- R Programming  
- Statistical Analysis & Machine Learning  
- APIs (REST, FastAPI, Postman, Swagger)  
- Containerization (Docker)  
- Version Control (Git)  
- Agile/Scrum Methodologies  
- Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)  
- Microservices Architecture  
- Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)  
- Database (Postgre, Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB)  

## Professional Experience

### Solutions Architect Intern  
**Amazon Web Services (AWS)**, Arlington, VA (Remote/Hybrid)  
Jun 2025 – Sep 2025  
- Designed and presented secure, scalable AWS architectures tailored to enterprise client needs.  
- Developed proof-of-concept (POC) solutions integrating Generative AI (Bedrock using fully managed LLM models), data analytics (Athena, Glue, SQL), and serverless computing (Lambda) to discover actionable business insights from constituent sentiment.  
- Built and deployed a fully automated sentiment analysis pipeline processing over 1M feedback records, enabling 5× faster feedback-to-action turnaround through real-time Amazon QuickSight dashboards.  
- Fine-tuned foundational models in Amazon SageMaker using instruction training, achieving a 5% increase in output accuracy and an 8% reduction in toxicity and hallucinations.  

### Software Developer Intern  
**WOPLLI Technologies**, Remote, NY  
Jun 2024 – Sep 2024  
- Designed Virtual Credential System (VCS) for decentralized identity ecosystems.  
- Configured and tested Azure environments for application hosting and deployment.  
- Produced data flow and architecture diagrams aligned with data governance policies.  

### IT Support Intern  
**Mayor’s Office of Information Services**, New York, NY  
Feb 2024 – May 2024  
- Automated troubleshooting with Python scripts, reducing manual workload.  
- Monitored logs and CrowdStrike dashboards to identify abnormal activities, escalating when appropriate.  
- Supported VIP users, ensuring secure system access (Active Directory, VPN, VOIP).  

### IT Instructor Assistant  
**RF CUNY & Generation USA (Choose-U)**, Remote, NY  
Feb 2022 – Aug 2023  
- Delivered 36 lessons on IT support, Linux, PowerShell, and scripting for 200+ learners.  
- Achieved a 96% cohort graduation rate by tailoring instruction with learner data insights.  

## Projects

### Alfred – Personal Agentic Job Search Assistant  
- Designed and developed a personal agentic job search assistant using FastAPI (Python) and OpenAI GPT-4.1 Mini for automated resume and cover letter generation.  
- Implemented a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system using a PostgreSQL database with pgvector to store and retrieve personal work data as embeddings (OpenAI embeddings mini model).  
- Established a CI/CD pipeline and Docker deployment for the FastAPI server and database, ensuring robust, tested, and integrated core features.  
- Built GitHub ingestions and job board API integrations for posting and fetching jobs, along with automated resume and cover letter generation.  
- Leveraged cosine similarity to match candidates to best-fit jobs.  
- Reduced time required to apply to job postings by 60% and increased completed applications per week by 300%.  

## Education

### Master of Science – Data Science and Machine Learning  
**City University of New York – School of Professional Studies**  
Expected Jan 2026  
- GPA 4.0, Dean’s List 2x  

### Bachelor of Technology – Computer Information Systems  
**City University of New York – NYC College of Technology**  
Jun 2024  
- GPA 3.78, Dean’s List (5x), National Honor Society  

## Certifications
- AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate  
- AWS Certified AI Practitioner – Generative AI  
- Google Cybersecurity Certificate  
- Google Information Support Certificate
